title: Mortgage Rates Jump to Highest Level Since March 2020
sub_head: Higher borrowing costs, combined with record-high prices, could push some buyers out of the market
body:
Mortgage rates have hit their highest level since March 2020, the month the coronavirus pandemic took hold in the U.S. and roiled markets.
The average rate for a 30-year fixed-rate loan was 3.45% for the week ended Thursday, mortgage finance giant Freddie Mac , up from 3.22% a week ago.
